content: Homepage of Yu Huang Dr. Yu Huang Professor, Ph.D. Supervisor State Key Laboratory for Novel Software Technology, Nanjing University School of Computer Science, Nanjing University Postal address: School of Computer Science, Nanjing University 163 Xianlin Street, Qixia District, Nanjing, Jiangsu Province, China, 210023 Office: Room 805, Computer Science and Technology Building Email: Short biography In July 2007, I joined the State Key Laboratory for Novel Software Technology, Nanjing University. I am a faculty member of the Institute of Computer Software and the School of Computer Science, Nanjing University. I worked as an assistant professor from 2007 to 2009, and as an associate professor from 2010 to 2016. I was promoted professor in 2017. I got my Ph.D. in computer science from the University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) in Jun. 2007. My supervisor is Prof. Yulin Feng. I got my bachelor's degree in computer science from USTC in Jun. 2002. Before entering USTC, I studied in the Suzhou Middle School, Suzhou China, from Sep.1995 to Jun.1997. I studied in the Technology Center of Software Engineering, Institute of Software, Chinese Academy of Sciences (TCSE, ISCAS), as a co-educated Ph.D. student of both USTC and TCSE ISCAS from Sep. 2003 to Jul. 2007. From Sep. 2005 to Sep. 2006, I studied in the Department of Computing, Hong Kong Polytechnic University, as a visiting student. Research interests Distributed algorithms Distributed systems Formal specification and verification System software correctness and reliability To potential students I am recruiting well motivated and dedicated Ph.D. / master students to do research in above-mentioned areas. Undergraduate students are also encouraged to contact me, to work on related topics.
